Losses module

training.losses.fetch_default_device() → torch.device[source]

Fetch default pytorch device (cuda or cpu)

Returns

Pytorch device object

Return type

torch.device

training.losses.get_edl_losses() → list[source]

Return the list of edl loss function strings

Returns

list of edl loss function strings

Return type

list

training.losses.get_loss_fct(loss_str: str)[source]

Get loss function from loss function string

Parameters

loss_str (str) – Name of loss function as string

Returns

Callable loss function

training.losses.edl_accuracy(yTrue: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor, yPred: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor) → None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor[source]

Get accuracy if using EDL loss function and labels

Parameters

  • yTrue (torch.tensor) – Ground truth label

  • yPred (torch.tensor) – Output of model

Returns

Mean accuracy of yPred with yTrue as ground truth

Type

torch.tensor

training.losses.res_to_dirichlet(ev: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor) → tuple[source]

Calculates belief vector and uncertainty value for the output of a model trained with EDL loss

Parameters

ev (torch.tensor) – Output of model

Returns

Tuple of (uncertainty values, belief vectors) - batched outputs stacked

Return type

tuple

training.losses.combined_loss(y_true, reasoning_out, intermediate_out, omega_value)[source]

Loss function used in Neuroplex [NOTE: not yet fully implemented]

Parameters

  • y_true – Ground truth label

  • reasoning_out – Output of reasoning layer

  • intermediate_out – Output of perception layer

  • omega_value – Omega value

Returns

Combined loss value
